dialogue: This was all happening inside of a car.
Got it. I misunderstood--
Why weren’t you picking up your phone?
I was asleep.
At 10:30? I called you at 10:30--
I was out late with some friends.
Did you get drunk?
Yes, I understand.
Mom, did you really think you were talking to Daniel? How did you think this was real?
You thought it was real too--
Well, she was very convincing!
You have to speak louder.
He’s making a joke.
Not really.
Yes, more than before. Her eyes open. And her face falls. She gets up and shuffles to the doorframe, listening in...
I haven’t noticed a big difference. Little things maybe--
She’s gotten these calls in the past.
What do you mean “new phase”?
I’m questioning whether living alone is the best option at this point in her life?
You think we’re there? I mean, I lost my wallet last week but I don’t think that’s a reflection of my mind deteriorating.
That’s a lack of presence, darling.
It’s a nice idea but I’m not sure it’s realistic. You’ve got enough on your plate and we should be free to focus on our job search.
You mean... my job search?
Of course, you know what I mean--
Right, yeah￾
I wouldn’t be able to forgive myself if something happened to her. Did you know Susan’s mother fell into a fire pit? Completely died--
Jesus! Why are we talking about this?
Things happen to people as they age.
So let me help.
You’re not a nurse. I wonder if she’s been taking the five blend. And the Astragalus.
She doesn’t need a nurse. You think she’s gonna listen to a stranger? She barely listens to dad.
She’ll listen to me. It was one bad day. And if it doesn’t work out, all options are on the table. Okay?
We could try that.
She got confused at Shutters. She forgot she ordered those spicy tuna rolls.
The tuna did look a little different. At Shutters.
Well, the food is good not great.
Never. Not like this.
I thought I lost her at Souplantation once but she was just going back for more little pizzas.
I can’t believe it was called Souplantation. Never really processed that.
It had things she can chew.
Who says that?
Everybody. Doctors. Professionals.
Why would you keep that from us?
Because I’m going to do it.
You need to be taking care of your vehicle, Daniel--
I understand.
Can we not talk about Allie--
I’m sorry! I know. It’s very hard. I don’t like to see you suffer like this. It makes me very sad. I feel like I want to cry.
Have you talked to her? Is there a schedule in place for the break? A timeline?
There’s no timeline.
...Do you need us to sit down with you and order a new license?
I can handle it. Let’s deal with one family crisis at a time, okay?
She posted!
She posted a picture?
I think by accident. Five minutes ago. Look--
Oh my god!
You can go a little faster.
Thank you! GOD!
Oh shit! Her Lyfe Line.
What’s it saying?
Could it have fallen off?
Not on its own.
She likes her independence from that thing.
I mean, sometimes she puts it in her bag. I can’t remember...
She didn’t want me to.
Why wouldn’t she want you to?
I don’t know, mom!
We’re all upset! This is exactly what we were trying to avoid and now my mother is... AT LARGE!
I can’t... do anything. I literally can’t do anything. I’m such a little bitch!
Don’t call yourself that!
I truly have no ability to do things. I can't do anything with my hands--
What were you trying to do with your hands?
What? Nothing! I just... I don't know any facts. I'm not qualified for any job. I can’t do math! That’s basically why Allie and I aren’t together--
Because you can’t do math? I thought she could do math!
It’s just another thing I can’t do! I haven’t gotten my ID replaced because every time I log on to that stupid website I get confused about the terms and classifications--
You have visual processing issues!
Sure! Or maybe I’m just a little bitch who can’t do anything!
Stop calling yourself that!
No. I want to go alone. I just need a little space to think.
Where will you walk?
I don’t know... just around.
Do you have your phone? Please don’t keep it on silent. Can you do that for me? For my mental health?
